i really did enjoy this movie and peter parker aka spiderman played by tobey maguire he did a great job in this movie and he was so good for this role and he was amazing as this character too and mary jane watson played by kirsten dunst she did a great job too as well and she was so awesome for this role and she is so beautiful and gorgeous too and i like her as a actress now and norman osborn aka the green goblin played by willem dafeo he did a great job as the main villain role for this foo and he was so awesome for this role and he did a very good in this movie too and harry osborn played by james franco he did a really good job too and he was so good for this movie role and he was so awesome for this role and it was nice to see him in this movie too and flash thompson played by joe manganiello he did a great job as the bully in this movie and he was awesome for this role but he was barely in this movie tho but it was cool to see him in this movie role tho and betty brant played by my girl elizabeth banks she did a great job too as well and she was so awesome for this role and she was so good for this movie too and she is so incredibly sexy as hell bro and she is so gorgeous too and i m a huge fan of her now love her to death man and finally j jonah jameson played by jk simmons he did a great job too and he was so good for this role and he was so funny in this movie too and can t believe it s been years now since this movie came out and that s insane it s been that many decades ago now and i was years old when i saw this movie came out and i was in nd grade when i saw this movie and i sure do missed those good old days back then too and time sure does flies in the movie world that s for sure jeremy bro and overall i m gonna give spiderman a stars i really did enjoyed this movie but didn t not like the ending that much but that s just me though in my opinions and thoughts on this movie jeremy jahns bro

i love this movie it s one of those movies that i loved as a kid and i still love and i will always love i love the soundtrack they got the origin story of spider man right this is also one of those movies where when i watch it i discover something new anyway i love willem dafoe as norman osborn green goblin he was awesome his laugh his anger his motivation his insanity and his violence his suit however looked weird it looked like a power ranger outfit but his writing was great like the scene where he captured spider man and he was telling him that in spite of everything he s done for the city eventually they will hate him that final fight between spider man and green goblin was brutal green goblin beat the crap out of spider man i rewatched this movie in march it still holds up it s the perfect origin story of spider man a great introduction to spider man and a great superhero movie
epic review for an epic movie

well it s official the original spider man is now years old i m very very thankful i found the first trailer for it on resident evil dvd and my dad took my sister cara and i to see it opening weekend then we saw it again after made million domestically and million worldwide i m really blessed that sam raimi tobey maguire kirsten dunst willem dafoe and james franco brought these characters to life with a great story acting heart fun special effects music and bringing an impossible comic book to the screen amazing supporting cast too with jk simmons rosemary harris and the late cliff robertson this is the movie that set the bar for all comic book filmmaking and that made me into a die hard movie buff collecting merchandise sequels a reboot a sequel to that and the mcu versions followed very happy nostalgia critic loved it has its silly moments but balances everything out with its campy vibe the angles and imagery a well set up origin story and good pacing brought some much needed hope and optimism after a post cultural landscape with permeating themes of heroism as a lonely form of sacrifice this includes the heroes and the villains they all have good motivations and arcs proved that the genre didn t need to be overly dark or straight up silly and thankfully brought comic book movies back again paving the way for the marvel cinematic universe and so forth

i hope tobey maguire knows just how big of a role he played not only in spider man but in the comic book community as a whole it s him and sam raimi who are to thank for essentially the birth of the mcu and the inspiration to filmmakers everywhere who have made excellent comic book movies an entire generation of fans actors and filmmakers alike are standing on their shoulders and if i have an inspiration it would have to be sam raimi for reinforcing the message that was in the comics from the beginning and exists with the character even today that anyone can be spider man and that it s about doing the right thing that s why i consider the raimi trilogy the best series of comic book movies of all time and raimi himself as one of the best filmmakers of all time

when i was kid i used to go on the internet to read up on action movies that were coming out mostly this entailed star wars prequel news and rumors surrounding a th batman installment in continuation schumacher s films one of the things i saw though was a picture of the green goblin and when my older brother called me a loser when he also saw the picture considering that the costume looked like some cheap power rangers outfit i can t say i blame him but part of me was more or less just unconvinced whether it was a real movie or not back in those days being a kid and all i couldn t tell the difference between fake internet rumors concerning sequels and actual movie news later that same year when i saw the fellowship of the ring the first lord of the rings film there was a trailer before the film for spiderman it blew my mind but not so much because i was a huge spiderman fan the truth is i liked the s cartoon and enjoyed reruns of the older spiderman and his amazing friends show but what amazed me was that i could tell that it was going to be visually spectacular it blended what i thought only worked in animation with live action angles that i had only seen in the matrix i did everything to make sure i was able to see it the day it came out may rd i m not lying when i tell you that i didn t have to look up that date however when the movie did finally come out i was disappointed i was years old and i felt like it was a little kids movie in the way it embraced the cheesiness ultimately i kind of just decided it was good it didn t take long for me to look past the faults and enjoy the film anyway i ended up buying it on dvd and enjoying it for years to come but the general life lesson was to not get my hopes up over a movie in the end it wasn t so much the movie s fault but my own for expecting it to be something more than it could be i went on to read the spiderman comics and to appreciate the source material more fully as a result i think i appreciate it even more today

this is still my favourite movie of all time and nothing will ever change that the newer spider man movies just haven t been able to capture the spidey tone as perfectly as sam raimi did it all those years ago what makes this movie so special is that it isn t just a great comic book film it s just a great film with plenty of heartfelt moments and perfectly written characters homecoming came close to capturing the spidey magic of old and i really do love that movie but holy crap was far from home a disaster that movie gave me absolutely nothing to love except for that one mysterio fight scene that felt like it was pulled straight out of the comics other than that the movie had me cringing the entire time i knew it was bad when even the jk simmons reveal at the end of the movie wasn t enough to get me excited after the trainwreck i had just witnessed oh well the good news is that tom holland is a good spider man i really hope the screenwriters make some drastic improvements to finish off his trilogy

i feel like the cheese was necessary looking back now considering raimi was paying tribute to the s spider man comics and all its campiness not to mention the soap opera of the comics in spite of the superficial details like the web shooters and the intellect raimi nailed the tone and message of the comics pretty well

i was in sixth grade i came back from school and my mom told me about a movie trailer she saw she said that it was a superhero movie and the guy was flying what was the movie s name i asked spiderman mom said wha me mom if he was flying he must be superman mom no it was spiderman later that day while watching television i saw that advert holy shit it was spiderman and mom just misinterpreted swinging as flying and boy i got excited this was the movie that i had to see i had never gone to a theater before and i bawled my eyes out rolled around the floor and did some other shit to make my parents take me to see the movie we couldn t afford it so we didn t go but the local cable operator in my area was a good guy he heard me cry one day and told me that the pirated one will be on television soon i waited eagerly and one day there it was my first english superhero movie i didn t understand one sentence but i didn t give a shit because of what i was seeing to this day i get misty when i hear the sound of that movie

as good as spider man was and even if it was a more technically proficient film i still have always enjoyed the first a little more but then i ve always been a sucker for origin stories i think what really does it the most for me though in this particular film is how we get to discover and be amazed right alongside peter as he s first realizing his potential also willem dafoe da foe the foe while i actually liked maguire a lot in those films after tom holland came along tom replaced toby as the best peter parker even if i still believe the first two spider man films as a whole are more enjoyable also i grew up as a comic book nerd and spider man and batman were my favorite solo characters although more spider man by a huge margin and x men for team characters all growing up i always wondered how long it would take before we got those translated to film in a good way if ever the burton movies were great for what he was able to do but they still seemed both simultaneously low key and over the top and not quite what i was wanting when the first two rami films hit they just floored me and i thought we have finally arrived in terms of translating a comic book character with the feel of a comic book character and without being ridiculous to film then nolan came along and made things more grounded and i thoroughly loved the first two of his batman films forward to avengers and what marvel has been able to do with the mcu and for the most part it s everything a kid like me would have wanted back then shitty hulk cgi aside it might have started with the first superman film but i think rami s spider man really set the ball rolling lastly keep the i haven t been able to go to the barber s since is bullshit look it s pretty suave

as a die hard spider man fan i have to say that no matter who plays the role and no matter how good or how bad the movie is i will always find some enjoyment in a spider man film this includes spider man and tasm and i have a tremendous amount of love and respect for tobey maguire andrew garfield and tom holland for playing my favorite superhero of all time but with all that being said my favorite spider man actor is and always will be tobey maguire simply cause seeing him as spider man or more specifically peter parker was the thing that really made me fall in love with everything comic books cause well he was a kid a teenager in high school with high school problems and i loved that i always say that tobey s spider man was my first love of comic books like i have a special place in my heart for his spider man and his movies i mean as much as i love homecoming and into the spider verse my personal all time favorite spider man movie will always be raimi s spider man like to this day i still get chills and sit at the edge of my seat when i see the train scene i love tom holland and andrew garfield in the role so much i really do but there s just something about tobey s movies that just idk hits different for me you know long story short tho is tobey will always be my favorite no matter what whatever life holds in store for me i will never forget these words with great power comes great responsibility this is my gift my curse who am i i m spider man

this movie holds a place near to my heart my family didnt have much growing up so birthdays where a small toy and a meal we didnt have the money to do more i was and saw the ad on tv for this movie called spiderman coming out near my birthday and i just thought i really want to see that i went around the neighborhood collecting cans and doing chores to find money for the movie on the day of my birthday i said i d go to a friends house and went to the theater with a pocketful of change i didn t know how money worked so i just dropped it all on the counter and said i want to see spiderman the guy at the booth helped me out by counting my coins helped me with the menu and brought me to the auditorium and there i was with my small popcorn and my medium coke enjoying the birthday gift i had worked so hard for i didn t really understand the plot i was scared shitless during norman s transformation to the point that i had nightmares and thats how my parents found out but i was so happy i fell in love with cinema at that moment i can t hear the opening theme without tearing up a bit it brings back the feeling that i could do everything and that i would work my way to my goals it s my most cherished cinema going experience and to this day that is still how i celebrate my birthday i have no party for myself no gifts my gf and mother always plan something now and get me a little something but i still go to the cinema and with the spare change i got through the year i buy myself a ticket a popcorn and a coke and feel invincible thank you jeremy for reviewing this your videos mean so much to me they helped me think about the world in a different way in a time i needed it they even lead into meeting my said girlfriend but thats a story for another time thank you for your time and effort i will keep watching everything you make

what s missing for me in the current spider man movies is the heart the raimi films had a lot of heart and i think is what elevated them considerably among the rest mcu spidey gets a lot of credit for being the spider man that finally joins the avengers which you know whoa spider man in the avengers cool not a snarky comment btw but i think the novelty of it wears off sam raimi didn t have any of that or in fact didn t really need any of it to sell spider man instead he added a lot of impact and weight to his stories say what you will about spider man but it gave us life lessons on forgiveness and revenge and put a lot of impact into harry s death which is honestly more than i can say for the end of endgame and to me that says a lot about the storytelling of both franchises one succeeds by having multiple superheroes on screen while the other succeeded by telling a compelling story which really showed the burdens that came with being a superhero and that to me is what audiences will look back more on not from being on screen with other large established characters not from having mindblowing set pieces but from having a lot of heart which is something i think comic book movies could really take a page from and the sam raimi trilogy really had a lot of it

jeremy mentions this moment but its a gem in the movie at the site of the burning building the officers approach in a hurry hold it right there we re taking you in upon hearing a woman screaming without hesitation peter turns to the man who would have arrested him and tell him i m going without much more than a second thought he s ready to put his life on the line in service of others similar to what good cops to and you have to imagine the police officer knew that as well the cop needed a moment to think i ll be here when you get back clearly a man following his orders and doing what he s told to preserve the law i m not coming back chief gotta love tobey s witty remark while also staying true to his heroic ideals i used to interpret this as peter didn t know what d happen if he went back inside that burning building and there s a chance he might go in there and never come out clearly the cop knew in his heart that his duty was to people and running out of time he has to make a decision but quickly tells peter go go peter lifts himself into the air before catapulting himself into the flaming window the small moments of genuine heroism something inspirational and gives you faith in people that s what its all about man

give the third movie a watch again it s flawed no question but it s still a good film eddie brock as a scumbag version of peter parker who literally shirks off responsibility at every turn is a good example of sam raimi doing what he does best with these films and emphasize the villains as dark reflections of the the hero with norman it was blind ambition with otto it was hyper fixation both of these demons were manifested into actual totems in the form of osborn s goblin persona and the tentacles taking over octavius s higher brain function you can actually see the transition as the light on them changes color with eddie it s all about his inability to actually own up to his own faults he never actively dates gwen outside of a single coffee meet up but can t take a hint he rightfully gets fired for faking pictures for the bugle but literally prays for god to striker peter parker dead i think the flaws come from venom having to be wrapped up entirely in a single film rather than being set up in and then becoming a looming antagonist in but raimi did as best he could with the studio interfering as much as they did

the sam raimi spider man series was what got me into spider man and to the marvel universe as a whole when i was a kid my dad him being a huge dc fan tried to get me into superman and batman but neither character really resonated with me when i saw this movie for the first time as a kid peter parker was so relatable that even as a kid i cared what happened to him as both peter and spider man this movie pushed me to read spider man comics and got me into the marvel universe as a whole i saw both sm and in theaters i read a lot of old amazing spider man and ultimate spider man comics and watched both the s spider man cartoon and the spectacular spider man series and while i also loved other marvel heroes such as iron man and captain america pre mcu days no character in all of fiction resonates with me as much as spider man does and that all started with sam raimi and his vision of spider man

for those of you that did t know there is another mid air trick that people have been talking about lately and it was seen in some of the game tutorials as well it is the diving corkscrew you need to find a real tall building preferably charge your jump for additional height and do not force into a swan dive by pressing l just wait until you transition into it by simply falling down from there hold your left thumbstick either left or right and then additionally press and hold circle and triangle together i think it s pretty neat as it adds to the existing moves however i also think that insomniac could have removed one of the flying helix tricks and replace it with something different maybe even looking into using the diagonals but that s just me

sorry ign this is most certainly not a the combat is a blast but can still be challenging even when you have hours of practice it never pushes the easy button the graphics are breathtaking the city looks amazing even when moving at high speed the cutscenes are polished well acted and engaging hearing jj rage about spiderman while you swing around is priceless the webswinging is what every fan of spiderman has been wanting not only is it epic but it s also strangely relaxing the collecting of pigeons drone and bomb challenges are exercises in webswinging skill it is asking how fast and nimble you can be stealth and combat challenges are how you can judge your thug beating skills or noir spidey style the backpacks are little glimpses into spiderman lore and peter parks life all in one the landmarks are nods to real locations in new york excluding mcu buildings which also bring the sense that spidey loves his city the suits are a mix of nods to mcu and some from the movies and comic books most with a unique look and ability also the small but noticable addition to high five new yorkers on the street really makes you feel like your friendly neighborhood spiderman ign get your facts straight

i really did enjoy this movie and peter parker aka spiderman played by tobey maguire he did a great job in this movie and he was awesome for this role and he was badass as this character too and he nailed it as spider man too and mary jane watson played by kirsten dunst she did a great job too as well and she was very good for this role and she is so pretty and very attractive too and i like her as a actress now and norman osborn played by williem dafeo he did a great job as the main villain role for this movie and he was awesome for this role and he sure did a great job as this character too and he was badass for this role and harry osborn played by james franco he did a great job too as well and he did a awesome job for this role and it was nice to see him in this movie too and flash thompson played by joe manganiello he did a good job as the bully in this film role but he was barley in this movie tho but he still did a good job when he was on screen though and betty grant played by elizabeth banks she did a great job too as well and she was awesome for this role and she is so incredibly sexy as hell bro and she is so gorgeous too and i m a huge fan of her now love her to death man and finally j jonah jameson played by jk simmons he did a great job too but he was barley in this movie tho but he still did a great job when he was on screen tho and can t believe it s been years now since this movie was released in theaters back then and that s insane it s been that many decades ago now and i was years old when i saw this movie back then and i was nd grade at the time and i sure do missed those good old classic days back then too and time sure does flies in the movie worlds that s for damn sure chris bro and overall i m gonna give spiderman a stars i really did enjoyed this movie but could of been little bit better if it was longer tho but that s just me though in my opinions and thoughts on this movie chris stuckmann bro

i can t be the only person who thinks that the sam raini trilogy of spiderman films are a poorly acted with the exception of jk simmons alfred molina and wilem dafoe the worst offender being the bland and uninteresting tobey maguire who remains monotone throughout b poorly written with the love story between mj and spiderman be beyond creepy and her later ditching of jameson s son you know the astronaut simply cruel to leave him at the altar that is if she didn t love him she shouldn t have let it escalate that far before breaking his heart i would also like to point out that the first two films are nearly identical with the villain s arcs only with doc ock being more likeable before his experiment goes wrong mj and peter getting closer before love confessions at the expense of an innocent harry and jameson s son you know the astronaut as well as the kidnapping of mj and nearly note for note the same power discovery scene yes i understand that it is supposed to be symbolic but to me has always come across as more robotic and rejecting followed by living by uncle bens great power great responsibility motto c woefully scripted how does peter think that learning poetry makes up for being ignorant an unfeeling towards mj even if he was doing it for the greater good mj doesn t know that the characters are also devoid of all subtlety and just state the blindingly obvious with as little inflection in their voices as possible i am well aware that this will be a very unpopular comment have at it these films are only great in concept but after having watched them all i can say is that i find peter a poor role model and again poorly acted so nothing is made up for mj a terrible role model and a walking stereotype and the film overall simply dreary i d rather watch green lantern at least everyone agrees that that was rubbish

spider man fun energetic heartwarming and heartpounding spider man heartbreaking inspirational dramatic action packed grounded and optimistic by the end spider man doesn t evoke any emotion of the first two movies but stands out as cheesy fun with a lotta awful moments the amazing spider man very dull with a bland plotline but i liked the chemistry between garfield and stone and the action scenes the amazing spider man so many things at once peter s backstory subplot peter and gwen gwen going off to oxford harry s dying or something and needs peter s blood electric boogaloo is bitten by some shiny fish and gets powers and now wants revenge on spidey because he forgot his name the sinister six set up destroyed any shining hope of spidey s tarnishing reputation in the movie due to rebooting criticism spider man homecoming fun funny light hearted joyous optimistic heartfelt and gives a glimmer of hope for the future spidey films to expand while retaining the joy and spirit of my favorite hero

love this movie but some of the editing blunders and such get to me now that i ve seen it so many times kind of surprised you didn t really go into any of it few examples in the scene where he fights flash near the lockers how did everyone know to clear a path for flash to fly past them also if you pay attention to the larger kid in the background after the fight is over you can see him with his mouth wide open shocked by what he saw when it cuts back to him seconds later he s clapping with a smug smile and then he reverts back to having his mouth wide open in shock again in the scene when he uses his web to cross the street for the first time after the up up and away web bit he clearly bounces off the wall only to have the scene cut and we see him comically slide down it seems like the editors should have trimmed the previous clip just a bit more once he tracks down the ben s killer he knocks the gun out of his hand during the fight but seconds later the guy has the gun in his hand again the scene where he is forced to make a choice between saving mj and the cable car makes absolutely no sense to me the only thing keeping that cable car from plummeting into the river is the tension goblin is keeping on the cable once he releases it the line should have gone slack and the only way spiderman could have saved it was to web the car itself or get hold of the end of the line goblin was holding instead somehow the car slips to the end of the cable and latches on and the other end of the cable which should extend the length of the path is now only about ft long and spiderman is able to grab on to that end of it huh i really only have these gripes because i ve seen the movie enough to notice them still one of my favorite superhero movies though despite having noticed these flaws i never did notice the dinner attire that was awesome

hey chris thanks for the nice review of spider man for me who grew up in the s and s reading silver age marvel comics sam raimi s spider man trilogy was great and i agree that toby maguire was the best peter parker on film to date the reason is that raimi managed to very nicely capture and bring the feel of the s comics to modern times without being hokey he understood the characters and their relationships and brought them all to the screen beautifully i loved all three movies even spider man which so many people knock people sometimes forget that the faults of spider man are more to do with the studio than with raimi he didn t originally have venom in the movie but added the character due to studio pressure but he made a great movie anyway as far as i m concerned my main complaint is that the studio didn t stick with raimi sure diminishing returns and all that but the argument doesn t work in this case the movie only made slightly less than the nd one domestically coming in at mil and almost mil worldwide which makes it the top grosser of the three and sony dropped him really sony and it s stoopid meddling do not deserve this character anyway chris as always great review

great review chris after watching this i really feel like going back and seeing the movie again on the spider man thing and the quips and what not i honestly like tobey maguire as spider man he was fantastic when it came out and ultimately he killed it in the role however his character just lacked progression to me my whole thing with peter parker personally is that he shows some of the best character progression out of any comic book character he s a soft spoken nerd looked down upon by everyone and falls in love with a girl hopelessly out of his league he wants to be more he s insecure and weak and loves science and blah blah he gets super powers and immediately you have given power to a guy who has always been weak has always been picked on and pushed around and now he instantly wants to show the world that he s better he gets cocky he becomes basically an asshole because that s how the world treated him so who cares then his uncle dies and he learns the great power responsibility stuff he s immediately humbled and grows as a person but even though he s doing all these amazing things and fighting all these people and villains it s not like he s automatically fearless he s just a nerd from queens of course he s scared he s scared out of his mind and because he s scared he hides that by making quips he belittles his villains he basically humiliates them because if you re fighting sociopathic humanoid rhinos and psychotic killer goblins and whatnot the first instinct is to make fun of them so they don t seem all that scary that s why the quips are so essential to his character tobey just never got passed the nerd stage and he never grew as a character he was the same andrew is closer to a perfect spiderman to me but ultimately he didn t show that outcast side enough he didn t seem all that weak or whatever so when he got his powers it s not like he changed much he just was himself a lot of people don t seem to recognize much that nerd peter parker is only like at best of spider man s whole character he s like that in the beginning but that quickly fades

ah spider man i m like you chris in that i remember going to the theater we got really crappy seats the ones in the very front this movie has a very special place in my heart i always liked sam raimi the evil dead franchise showcased to me how talented he was and how this guy should make bigger blockbusters and this is a common theme most of the big name directors did do b rated movies heck look at james wan he s transitioned out of horror films which he had done a fantastic job and i do not like many horror movies but i digress this film in one word was fun it was campy and over the top sometimes it was a tad bit too much but a lot of people tend to forget that was what spider man was during the s but this film wasn t afraid to get serious by nailing the core of who peter parker was it honestly delivered a really heartfelt story and for that you have to give sam raimi credit a lot of us tend to forget that superheroes back then weren t as big as today sure there was x men but given batman and robin and steel and all those pieces of garbages they were looked down and for sam raimi to take a character who is arguably one of if not the most popular superhero in the world and make a film about him must have been massive especially considering as what i stated above superhero films weren t looked at as positively as they are now so overall sam raimi s accomplishment should be noted but regardless despite the flaws i love this film many people say star wars was their childhood nostalgia despite me being a diehard star wars fan i like both the ot and the pt i never grew up with them aside from the pt this trilogy i grew up with so it holds a very special place in my heart

i don t particularly love the first two spider man movies in fact i think spider man at times has some pretty awful dialogue and just flat out hur durr writing but the nostalgia and feel i get from them is great i mean like many i don t like nickelback but remembering the feeling from listening to hero as a kid there s just something so distinct about it also another very nostalgic memory is when i was a little tyke when the world seemed infinitely larger than i feel now i was looking up at the poster for spider man in theaters it was really big keep in mind and was also the first time i saw it as well as first confirmation the movie was even happening it was such a surreal awe capturing moment it felt as though i was up in the sky with spider man a completely indescribable feeling somewhat off topic from the review but i love raimi despite not loving his spider man films while also simultaneously loving comics i would love to see him get another crack at the character at marvel jon watts can do a trilogy while sam raimi does a venom film and drew goddard who wrote the martian but abandoned directing it as well as showrunning daredevil to do sinister six only to have it shitcanned and sent off to marvel to do a sinister six film so basically sony s plan from the beginning but much more inspired considering it is within the marvel machine and raimi won t be forced to do anything and venom is very much in line with raimi s sort of s spider man sensibilities both sinister six and the venom film should be spider man centric though i don t know i just love this idea because it would create spider man s world within a larger world and it would make his lore much more diverse and creatively fresh plus spidey has too much material to cover in just movies alone

the power rangers suit for green goblin was a hold over from the michael keaton batman era of the late s they beefed up batman from tights to something a little more like body armor and that look caught on in things like power rangers sam raimi had to fight to prevent spidey from having to wear clunky power rangeresque body armor imagine if spiderman had been wearing a chunky red helmet like goblin had to wear the concession was that spidey s suit had to at least have raised d webbing over the mask arms and legs and green goblin had to stay klunky but could be shot without his shitty helmet in close up scenes raimi continued to push this actors without masks thing in the next two spidey movies in spidey you see spiderman without the mask a lot and even in every close up of venom has the black goo peeling away to reveal topher grace s face delivering the lines raimi destroyed the power ranger asthetic going on in hollywood at the turn of the century and softened the ground of other great superhero flicks to really take off as the twenty teens began the first iron man is greatly informed by what raimi did on this score yes iron man should seem like the ultimate plastic cgi power ranger but it didn t come off that way because of all the close ups of tony stark inside the helmet talking to jarvis you never forget who is inside that suit and behind that mask that said despite everything willam defoe did a spectaular job as green goblin in the first spider man even if he had to be the last power ranger my only other comment i agree that biologial web shooters make a lot more sense for peter to have invented tech web shooters in his uncle s house would have been a stretch because where did he get the money to develop this and even if he had why not just patent the tech and make bank while allowing first responders everywhere to use it for saving lives i don t know what they ll do with future spiderman movies but i do think raimi created a couple classics that will stand the test of time

looking back on this film i generally like the casting and honestly some of the feel good moments where the cast really shines even in the goofy part but as i got older i realized the reason why i like spider man is not really because of the relatable nerdy character living every comic book nerd fantasy but really how its a tale about an incredibly talented person who becomes gifted with powers and decides how to use them and live his life responsibly with such a burden especially when come face to face with overwhelming odds while spider man is an insanely cool character its ultimately peter parker you come to respect and idolize which is what distinctively separates him from other dual identity heroes like batman or superman while i like mcguire s performance as parker the character himself is really not much more than a cliche nerd gets the girl trope everyone s general harsh treatment towards him seem weirdly outdated and out of place simply making it kinda hard to relate or take seriously at times which sort of tone just carried itself throughout the series especially when it attempted a more serious approach in and i e the dance scene

richards level but he s a pretty good scientist he was top of his class in fact there were so many instances in the comics as well as the animated series where he got out of shit just by using science and his brain having peter build his own web shooters shows how much of a genius he is a normal high school student can t build anything like that but peter isn t just a normal high school student who gets up for school and does his homework every once in a while that s what i really loved about the marc webb films even though they weren t perfect you still see how smart peter is organic web shooters just take that and a good part of the comic book away also peter is always known for his jokes and fast quips i m fine with those two jokes in the movie but what i m not fine with is that they re probably the only two he uses on villains in the entire trilogy if you ve read a spider man comic book you know he uses his humor as part of his defensive strategy i guess cause when you re smaller compared to an iron giant it helps using humor to make the big seem not so big that s what spider man does that s who he is if you say two jokes per movie or worse two or three jokes per trilogy is good then do you even have an accurate representation of who spider man is yeah he s cheesy yeah he s a shy teenager but a main part of his personality and why people love him so much is because of his fast quips there is a line i admit between sounding like an asshole and being able to deliver a few fast quips i think tasm not the tasm did a better job at capturing spider man for who he is granted i still don t think either movie has gotten the perfect spider man yet i m hoping tom holland can do that and while i still do love the original spider man people need to stop praising it as the greatest film ever cause it most definitely was not

id heavily disagree id say despite the lack of facial emotions is more than made up for by the body language and the cinematography i think a still mask is far superior its more menacing and it fullfills the purpose of the mask spider man doesnt wear a mask just for protecting his identity but he made it specifically to hide his emotions most specifically fear we see his eyes move in the comics but in that world those people dont see that only we do for the sake of the story the static mask fits this perfectly it masks his emotions and makes him intimidating the criminals of new york despite it not being touched on as much fear spider man and a lot of that is due to not just his inhuman contorting but his mask i dont think an enclosed and emotionless face is a hinderance to a character or preformance if that was the case the mandalorian wouldnt be successful nor would v for vendetta be as good as it is v for vendetta is an excellent example of both nonexistant facial emotions and minimal body language still resulting in a captivating and emotional character i think tobey did a well done job doing this we see in no way home they attempted to mix both cgi and a moving mouth to a static mask with andrew garfields character and it looked horrible and unnatural other than that this is an amazing video and an even more spectacular retrospective well done man

the nitpick about peter s strength shouldn t be seen as a fault in the movie more a fault of the character if you have issue with it you could say the same about nearly every fight against villains peter s had in the comics because he is so freaking strong in the comics when doc ock switched bodies with peter he punched scorpion s jaw off without meaning to literally punched it clean off he could kill a normal human with one punch without even trying that s how strong he is he holds back almost every time he fights so that he doesn t risk killing them when you re that strong it could be hard to figure out how far you can go before they die from the hit without trial and error and peter is not willing to do that so he severely holds back so he doesn t kill them he could win any fight with one hit to the head and knock them out but it s a fine line hitting them hard enough to knock them out and hitting them hard enough that it kills them especially when you re so strong that you could kill them without trying at all it makes the line even thinner so he s not even coming close to hitting with his full strength in fights to be honest he s hardly hitting at all but to normal humans it feels like a full hit when the punch lands and constantly holding back your own strength like that would be exhausting but peter does it anyway even when a fight is going south he still won t give it his full strength cause he doesn t want to kill them just another reason i love spider man really

on the topic of the mask i agree that one of of the character s biggest attributes is his humanity but we get to see a lot of that through peter i remember reading something about the reasons why certain heroes wear what they wear take batman for example he wears a cowl in the shape of a bat but we can see the bottom half of his face and or partially his eyes the reason for this is because he wants to inflict fear upon his enemies he wants them to know who their up against whereas someone like spiderman wants to hide his fears from his enemies therefore he covers his whole face also the raimi films in particular did something that we just don t see as much in the other movies suit battle damage raimi movies his mask costume is all torn apart by end of the third acts with his mask being torn exposing half his face you get to see those emotions if anything this shows his humanity more this shows that he s willing to go to extreme lengths to keep his friends family and his city safe anyway that s all i wanted to say about the costume issue great video

here s why i think doc ock is able to take spider man s punches spider man holds back the obvious one it s well established spider man holds back his punches in the comics he fought a fairly large man knocked him out cold with a flick of his finger a regular punch would likely kill someone spider man is losing re gaining his powers in the bank fight peter is losing his powers his webbing stops midway so his powers are weakening including his strength later in the burning building he couldn t barge down a door without hurting himself so not only is he holding back his attacks he s losing them simultaneously and during the train fight it can be argued his powers are still returning slowly when doc ock sabotages the train that s when they fully return as peter wills them to stop the train looking at it from that it not only helps explain why ock can take his punches but makes stopping the train more impactful this is where his powers return completely after losing them throughout the film they re finally back doc ock s arms numb his pain doc ock s arms have strong control over his mind influencing his id making him act on his dark emotions as such since they control at good deal of of his mental awareness it can be argued they control a portion of his nervous system which connects to the brain particularly his pain receptors numbing his pain or transferring it to themselves so when spider man attacks ock it might damage his body but he doesn t feel pain rather the arms do hence why they react more like they re taking the attacks than he is all these added up we get spider man holds back his attacks against doc ock whilst his powers are leaving him the arms help numb ock s pain and receive it themselves the criticism is there but this does weaken it a lot

spider man was definitely the standard but overall the raimi films are highly romanticized and overrated the mj character and casting haven t been right since the animated series raimi combined mj and gwen stacey gwen was the girl next door and mj was a party girl there are always peripheral traits story arcs and aspects of characters overall that are adjusted depending on the medium but it s important to make sure that they don t change the fundamental nature of the character story and mj being the party girl who s down for anything to have a good is extremely important not so much for spider man but definitely for peter parker who sees in mj everything he d love to be and can t peripheral traits are much different than defining traits also mj is supposed to be smokin hott and kirsten dunst isn t even close to that giving her a rating on the hott o meter is being generous and grading on a curve instead of using topher grace as eddie brock also horrible casting raimi should ve used topher s s show cast mate to play mj laura prepon in the early s was perfect for the role what about eddie brock i always felt like seann william scott would ve been good in that role in fact he was my personal choice to play deadpool back in when i was and heard that fox was bringing the x men to the big screen i still think he would ve been incredible as wade wilson but that clusterf ck of a franchise and its casting are a completely different conversation

so to explain the otto octavius not immediately getting wrecked every time spider man touches him the inhibitor chip frying basically removed the limiters on the tentacles but by extension stopped protecting otto s higher brain functions among those functions include the unconsciousness response that would likely be initiated after taking a concussion by extension otto s own supernatural constitution is a result of this it s not that he s suddenly become stronger it s that his muscles and body as a whole are exerting themselves with no regard for long term health and wellbeing he s at all the time

i m truly sorry to hear about what you had gone through with your grandmother and then father i understand how mentally and emotionally exhausting that can be my father began reading me spider man comics when i was young around four or five years old seeing the heroic actions of spidey on those pages helped lay the groundwork for the person i would become it was the earliest point in my life that i can remember where i felt my moral compass developing even if i didn t know what it was yet there have been many many times where i ve felt so lost and defeated and spider man media is something that i can always fall back on during difficult times to remind me why i need to pick myself up and push forward or do the right thing even when it is hard it brings me genuine happiness when i hear others stories about how this character has helped them

hi mark just lemme tell you something i was never so happy for a recommended video before out of all spider man video essays yours is the one that really resonated with me once in a while i would see some of your dbs videos or recently berserk my favorite manga but seeing you review about spidey really hit me hard and i couldn t help but come here and say some words also subscribe to your channel a thing i hardly do since i don t spent as much time on the internet as before to start i am here with tears in my eyes and i want to say i feel sorry for your loss and what you ve been though these past years i too have been through a lot my best friend and surrogate brother passed away two years ago and recently may this year my dear granny which was more like my mom since she raised me with my aunt since i was a kid i was lucky for seeing her one last time at the burial but couldn t stay with her at hospital due what s happening right now in this world even tho it was pneumonia it always left me the feeling of lack of resolve since when i was born i was also very ill and for years she stood by my side holding my hands in the hospital and i couldn t do the same i tried so hard and just like you i had really hard time with anxiety and all that comes together for all the hardships we went through our lives until them although i am trying my best now but the reason i am saying this is i really hope you are ok and i am very thankful for such honest take and video i love these spider man movies and recently have been rewatching over and over due to their eternal message of conflict and hardship how one should do its best despite all odds which frankly is why the sam raimi trilogy always felt special to me since i was a teen back then i thought i knew what was hard until very recently i am facing my losses the mistakes of the past being and adult and not having a job for so long and feeling like the whole world is against me rising up again still like many other things in this life memories people videos like these we find a glimpse of positivity words that makes worth to fight for this is why i find it hard to connect to new spidey movies and comic books and i don t say that to be mean and shit on their fans and strenghts it s just because the raimi trilogy resonated better with me back then and much more now that life can sometimes look so tough i look on my old pile of spidey comic books and they helped me so much back then and their messages were so good like the boy that collects spider man or more recently leah among others that makes us feel immersed and different more than an action flick or full cgi fun it was just different and about your video i think you nailed it i can see how much effort and passion you put in these videos you make but also the honesty behind your works i can only be thankful today i think i needed some of your words sorry for oversharing here and also the long essay i am not as good as you speaking up my mind besides english is not even my native language but again i really appreciate this video and i just wanted to say your words really touched me and how i really feel by rewatching those pieces have a great day

these movies have so many fantastic quotes and i don t mean the memes or jokes i mean the serious deep motivational quotes about what it means to be a hero you have the classis with great power comes great responsibility of course another great one was i guess one guy really can make a difference nuff said it is short and sweet it boils the message of these movies down to a bite size package and to think that one was from spiderman said during a stan lee cameo of all things maybe that s the most genuine wholesome stan cameo of them all not a joke or a gag but stan speaking directly to peter with words of wisdom remember we wouldn t have any of these great stories and heroes without stan one guy who managed to make a difference to hundreds of thousands of people who view his characters as inspirational heroes but i agree with you mark that aunt may s hero speech in spiderman is really powerful i believe there s a hero in all of us that keeps us honest gives us strength makes us noble and finally allows us to die with pride even though sometimes we have to be steady and give up the thing we want the most even our dreams she is essentially elaborating further on uncle ben s message to be responsible means as she said to be willing to give up the thing we want the most to do what s right i think hearing that helps peter realize the value in what he represents to other people sometimes it is fun to stop purse snatchers and hear people cheer when he shows up but that is all fluff what actually matters is that regular people look up to him for all his weakness and flaws he has managed to inspire people to strive to be more heroic that is worth all the sacrifices he has to make because it is bigger than him he has the opportunity to build other people up and make them into heroes too

i think comparing the train scene from maguire to the ship scene from holland is disingenuous maguire s scene is meant to be his peak whereas holland s scene is meant to be his lowest point the parallel is intentional as it really shows just how far holland s spider man has to go as his idea of heroism is completely tied to his spider man identity and it s not as much about the people as it is about being a hero his entire arc in the movie is being a hero because it s his responsibility not because he wants to maguire s spider man has this scene be his defining moment as a hero as he s ready to accept the responsibility of being a hero holland s spider man has this scene as the complete opposite and while it s intentional i think comparing them as you did is disingenuous to holland

i ve watched a lot of videos of people talking about spider man before this my favourite review was the trilogy hitopfilms made for the raimi series but now this video is my definitive favourite i genuinely started crying when you were talking about aunt may s speech in spider man that scene means so much to me for similar reasons to yourself spider man took me out of a dark place and that movie continues to inspire me many times when i am struggling to go on wondering what is the point of trying i often think back to spider man i think about how peter didn t need to be spider man and could ve had a good life but he chose to accept a life of responsibility and he chose to live with the consequences everything you have said in this video is spot on and i m so glad you made it this video is a genuine piece of art

this video reminded me of why these films were such a high point of my childhood from relating to the helplessness of pre superpower peter then the everyday struggles of affording rent maintaining friendship relationships to feelings of inadequacy and being unable to accomplish your goals when it quite literally feels like the entire world is against you hits me now more than ever as a year old as much as i enjoyed the garfield and holland movies the raimi maguire trilogy will forever be my favourite superhero movies even more so just favourite movies overall and i will never tire of the morals ideals and genuine struggles these stories do such a fantastic job of displaying your minute moment about the declining health of your family members and the eventual anxiety surrounding your own mortality is such a universally relatable mindset i can t even stress how much as stupid as it may sound how much this video choked me up it s those kind of moments during such well thought out and in depth analysis scripts that make me keep coming back to this channel the sheer effort and genuine thought provoking dialogue these video essays instill are just absolutely fantastic thanks for everything you do mark in the words of the incredible aunt may there s a hero in all of us

the tragedy of venom s inclusion is the character actually does fit s theme of forgiveness in the comics peter actually does wrong to the symbiote who instead of a corrupting force was a alien with a innocent outlook that wanted nothing more than to serve peter and be a super hero this and bonding to eddie brock who was also a flawed heroic character led to both characters becoming villains due to their desire of revenge before ultimately forgiving peter and becoming anti heroes and the first spider man spin off character if one does not count the punisher as great as that s cartoon is it s need of to simplify the character has helped utterly warp people s perception of the character as sam would take that and then exorcise any redeeming qualities that version had resulting in a complete and total opposite in every single possible way version of who venom is and as a result venom suffered in most adaptions going forward with the exception of a few video games eddie believe or not has been a good guy for most of his life as a character it has gotten to the point that people find fault with the two great venom movies because they assume that warped perception was comic accurate while the movies instead mostly faithfully adapt venom s original s run of mini series after mini series though they do have their adaption flaws as well like with cletus and carnage s bond thats why you re completely right about spider man venom got me into comics and as such seeing the character depicted so wrongly to the point i consider this to be venom s worst ever adaption outweighs any positives the movie has for me

an explanation for the apparent plot hole that peter should be able to knock out doc ock with one punch is otto s spinal implant since the implant goes all the way up otto s spine it could protect him against whiplash not only that but if the arms are doing some of the work then they could use that spine to make otto roll with the punches so that none of spider man s hits ever land full force in the most extreme example even if otto does get knocked out the arms could just puppet his body they can operate whether or not otto is awake and since they are connected directly into his nervous system the arms could theoretically even control otto s body while he s unconscious the hospital scene also implies that the arms have the ability to wake him up too so the whole doc ock should be beat with one punch argument doesn t hold any water as a matter of fact the only times doc ock is ever defeated is when the arms themselves are directly damaged

you mentioned vhs so now i have a heartbreaking story to share sit yourself down and have a calming tea because you ll coil in horror as i did the time was the early s i started watching dragonball z religiously as i was years old my mother then suggested she tape the series so we could always watch it back then we had a lot of power outages or times where we didn t pay the bills on time and had to work with what we got i can imagine you figured out what we did during these times as i had the vote of importance because i was the youngest the favorite even if it was never admitted we watched the tapes of course so much so that i knew lines by heart in the exact tone and gravitas it annoyed them to no end i had a blast fastforward to and we decided to for old times sake rewatch the entire series on tape but the quality was worse than usual usually because it s tape you have enormous static and grain making it hard to make out but never enough to care this time we couldn t see anything at times and the sound magically disappeared and reappeared whenever so we decided to take it out when we did oh my god the tape of the cassette got stuck inside the player and couldn t be salvaged it snapped like my soul that very moment what makes this worse is that it was the ocean dub combined with funi dub it s the rarest to find that tape was the only one of its kind and we never had the chance to put it on disc or online so now it s a memory that i have to take with me to my grave eu release you will forever be memorized by me and me alone the times you gave me with my family will never be outshined i hope that everyone has good memories like i do this time in my life was magical and i hope everyone experiences something like it at least once thanks for reading have a blessed day ps i found an ocean dub release online on piratebay the next year so i at least have some form of my childhood back it s not that different but the buu saga is not the same i remember vegito s voice being that of the funi dub but the lines were the exact same as that of the ocean dub in the ocean dub there is only a single voice that tries to emulate an amalgamation of both characters honestly it s a pretty damn good job of it too mad respect for the vas

watching your review it really shows how spider man works so much better in concept than execution everything you said the themes the idea of peter being the true villain harry s arc they all work and should come together into a great story the problem is that it s a story that could never fit in a feature length movie too much of it had to happen off screen or in quick scenes that we don t get the same connection as in the first movies while i ve made the too many villains complaint myself before i genuinely believe that was just a symptom of the over ambition of the project i like to imagine a version of this movie where ended with peter realizing how far he d fallen and the climax is him fighting his personal demons and overcoming them to free himself from the symbiote then the fourth movie would be focused on him then facing the consequences of his prior failings but now with a full movie to let them show and develop rather than trying to fit that level of gravitas into the last half hour of an already break neck story

i might not agree with most of what you had to say about spider man as that is my least favorite film out of the trilogy even worse than spider man yes i know blasphemy however what you said at resonated with me a lot as something similar happened with me years ago during my formative years in high school i was diagnosed with depression and it got so mad i even tried to kill myself at least times i was lucky that each time i had someone to talk me off the ledge to make me if for just a split second feel better and think that life was worth loving if only for a bit longer eventually my mother took me to these doctors not sure the specific they were but they wanted to put me on antidepressants but i hated the idea it made me feel even worse after that she d take me out of school once a week to do something weather it was going to the beach ten pin bowling or even the movies we d do something and while everything helped nothing worked for long the fact i was being bullied at school whenever i was out in the open didn t help so i usually found myself in the library and we didn t have a big comic book section as i live in australia so i didn t grow up with comics the way other countries did i m only just getting into them now thanks to ebay and certain apps but anyway i discovered one particular comic it was a re release of amazing fantasy spider man s very first and at the time of release potentially only release but then it became super popular and here we are but what i read in that comic inspired me so much i had already seen the sam remi films and loved spider man but the way the comic book told peter s origins helped inspired me it was the book i borrowed most i read it probably at least times when i first found it in the library that day then borrowed it and every time i had to return it i d borrow it straight away again unless someone had their name down for it then i d always be checking in to see if its back yet or not and every time i felt down or depressed or suicidal i d read that comic it helped me get through high school i now have a copy of that very comic on my book shelf not because i need it anymore but just as a reminder of how bad things were and how far i ve come and how strong i am so yeah to a degree i know how you feel spider man and stan lee and everyone who worked on amazing fantasy saved my life maybe not directly or intentionally but they did it none the less
i think you might have one me over on pt i struggled with it and for a while the whole trilogy because of it but now im all in this trilogy walked so the mcu could run

i don t think including the villains in spiderman was a mistake like you said the were all created by peter i think the issue was making eddie be venom too soon had the other two been given a chance to confront peter together while he was black suited up and after he hurt mj it would have created a more centralized climax of all the various plots of the movie tying everything together into one if then as a result of this eddie got the symbiote it would have been a better way to lead to the climax it would have also served more time for harry to think things over before allying with peter and time for sandman to have a better character arc of his own to depict him as caught between good and evil further it would have allowed raimi to show peter apologizing to mj and her clearly agonizing over it before he finally saves her to cleanly end to movie the final fight would have been more of peter and harry with help from sandman defeating venom and eddie this would have created more flow and made all the chaotic plotlines seem far more intentional also one more thing i don t think venom should ever not be used as a mechanism so long as peter parker is in the story though i wouldn t have minded if he d had more of a character of his own jealous possessiveness of peter and anger and betrayal at being abandoned this would have also served to set him equal to norman and otto and created an interesting element for peter to agonize over

for this whole moment i have a similar experience but from a different point of view i had cancer last year and while i no longer have it my body is a shell of what it used to be i was in the army at the time as well and in the best shape of my life and from march to now it is extremely difficult to do certain tasks like lifting something heavy walking somewhat fast or even jogging to even yelling if the situation calls for it since my heart rate in all of those examples sky rockets and basically drops me the thing is physically i m painfully aware that i can t do anything i used to do but mentally i still can t come to terms with it more than a year later i constantly have friends and family constantly telling me to be careful and just very worried for me when before they used to think i was the invincible one but are now more concerned for me more than they ever have been it a very hard feeling to come to terms with

the third one even if it s not as strong as the first two is still a good movie and doesn t have nearly as many flaws as people make it out to be it s just that its development of the villains is a bit inconclusive as full stories because there were villain stories being cooked while peter s own story was also being cooked so kind of important storylines sandman harry the symbiote and eddie combined as storyline kinda because of how he ends up being a villain and peter even though it s not perfectly developed it has great stories in there it just needed to have a few more scenes of each and it would ve been perfect it s like you order dishes of food and each comes with only of what they should ve come with it s still a good amount they re not small dishes enough to be too small just needed to have a bit more on each part but the finished product is still good even if it s not fully completed and the stories being told were at parts good and at parts great sandman s was nice even though it wasn t finished but enough for him to have a purpose so i liked him as a villain he got the daughter thing and the uncle ben thing it was enough a bit flat but he did get motivation and even backstory and peter forgives him knowing that he himself made many errors and hurt people and decided to just forgive him and put stuff in the past since sandman killing ben was not intentional harry was great it s not like he needed a lot more than what he got he got to fight peter confront him be hurt by him ended up being a villain when he fought him at night and then helped in the final fight and died and we already had seen him in the first movies so the cake was already baked well enough the symbiote well with peter it was great it gave him power but also corrupted him peter had many scenes showing that so on that part it was amazing peter dancing and being a douche is in character with the symbiote making him be selfish and stuff it s funny out of context but it s not a flaw of the movie or anything that makes the movie worse by any means the audience disliking bully maguire is exactly what peter acting like a douche because of the symbiote should ve caused and did then with eddie it was great as a threat to peter too because venom was very powerful the only thing missing was a bit more development for eddie even though it wasn t really needed in the movie s context eddie had already been fired because of peter had extremely fresh resentment towards him the symbiote got him and told him it was peter and both of them wanted him eddie to destroy him and the symbiote too but it kind of wanted for peter to be his host if possible the thing is both wanted to hurt peter and about peter he had a lot of development in this movie too he could ve used a bit more to match what he had in the first movies had there not been other important plots but it was still great because it didn t rush the symbiote making him selfish it really had many scenes of him being like that so i never understood the actual points of why so many people say that the third one is bad apart from people disliking bully maguire which is actually the strongest aspect of the movie making so many people dislike the hero s actions when they re supposed to the villains not having enough development as the others in movies and venom not being as great as everyone expected which is the same as the point above this but enhanced by it being so expected to be great and with almost everyone saying that it s a bad movie people will jump to that conclusion too omitting that it never reaches the bad level it s a special case of the movie not having enough scenes but also not having too few to make it bad but it was never a bad movie or anything close to that it s just one of those pieces of art kind of buried by the oh it s bad comments when it s actually good overall it was great in many ways it was decent with others the characters act like they re supposed to act with what happens to them in the movie it just needed some more scenes to be really strong but it s jarring how people just ignore how the characters and stories are good and just see how there should ve been more scenes or one less villain as if the final product weren t good on its own when it is a movie can be the weakest part of its trilogy have problems and still be good

if he liked spider man i feel like mark s gonna be pleasantly surprised by tasm i didn t love the andrew garfield films growing up since i grew up with the raimi films but honestly tasm may just be better than the mcu spidey films at least in certain regards it s on par with spider man if you were to ask me maybe even just a little better than it due to the story s focus on peter and his search for his parents plus we get to see some more of that egotistical behavior before peter learns to be spider man akin to what mark was talking about in the origin story from the comics and i wish i didn t go into that film originally when i was younger with such a heavy bias now tasm it has good moments and still feels more like a spider man film than the mcu titles despite its problems but that movie is undoubtedly a train wreck i won t go about defending the awful dialogue at parts in the film or how poorly harry osborn was implemented and how unnecessarily edgy he comes off as but the idea behind electro s character was at least somewhat interesting albeit poorly executed and the relationship between peter and gwen in the film still felt pretty fleshed out and awkward at least in terms of the acting the dialogue is kind of dog shit at points which is in character for tasm s peter parker so yeah i m really curious to hear what mark s thoughts are on both the mcu spider man films and little tony stark jr along with tasm and garfield s spider man

contrasts that wickedly i get the desire of her wanting to feel loved and i have my feeling abnout peter and that stunt with the kiss but i ll get into that in a moment as for mary jane her struggles with life in the theater love both make no sense and had simple solutions there should have been no issue hearing her singing as she should have been mic d even putting that aside she was still doing great with straight plays every time she has a chance to tell peter what s going on or how she s feeling she choses not to she s handling this whole situation like a martyr it feels more like she s upset that peter spider man s getting all this attention and not her this all felt avoidable as for peter and his cockiness before he even gets the symbiote let s break down his journey because it shows how narritavely this makes sense at the start of the st movie we see a kid who is treated like crap by everyone in his life aquaintences strangers alike his life is miserable he can t win in any part of life and then he gets his powers like anyone would react if they got powers he s filled with excitement loving this new ability he finally feels like he can catch a break now but he s still a guy who s been bit a lot throughout life so when he finally decides to bite back at one of the many pricks in life in the event when he allows the prick who cheated him out of three grand to get robbed the bite comes back to knaw at him with uncle ben s death between that choice the life lesson uncle ben left for him itself he s now taking up the responsibility of being a hero however he now has a city that hates him and by the end of the film he s left with a strain on his relationships between harry who now unknowingly hates him and mj who loves him but he must turn down he has not yet found that proper balance in life cut to spider man we still see all this disharmony as his life is even a bigger struggle he struggles to balance work school life rent friends love family guilt all while being spider man all while people still resenting spider man so when the time comes where he decides to hang up the hero life he starts to find the rhythmy balance with life in some spots however he nows sees it s too little too late in terms of harry mj on top of all that he struggles to have to watch as people he could save are hurt or die everywhere he goes he soon is relieved of his guilt when he tells aunt may the truth but then when he finally becomes spider man again in the final act mj harry both learn that he s spider man by the end of the film mary jane wants him to be able to feel love while being who he is he deserves a break and she s happy to go on this rocky road with him peter has now nearly found that harmony nearly got his life in perfect balance all that remains is harry cut to spider man we have peter talking about how he s now doing well in school his work life is stable he s juggling everything well with spider man who people now love and he s happily in love with mary jane but he still does not have harmony for harry still resents him but after their tussel in which harry nearly dies he loses his memory and that hostility is over peter is releaved even though twistedly it nearly cost harry his life and subconsciencely this might twist peter a slight bit without him realizing it nearly losing his friend has got him everything he s ever wanted he has acheived harmony balance his life is perfect now add onto that him suddenly recieving a key to the city in a parade ceremony praising him it makes sense that he would start to get a little cocky peter is not use to this his life has never been so good not everyone who has a tough life can always be so humble this narratively makes sense for peter but now there s the part of the film that does make me gag everything that is topher grace as andy brock venom his introduction alone is dreadful as we meet a pompis narcissistic douche bag who thinks he s the hottest shit a master of his craft as gwen s father just watches helplessly as his daughter is hanging for his life brock insensitively decides to say oh yeah i m dating your daughter and is taking pictures of her hanging for her life he s only just started to date gwen but states that he s in love with her and acts like it s much more serious than it actually is and only when it s convenient for him he tries to shmooze up to jonah by stating i have a girl who i intend to marry only seconds after flirting with someone else in the office when he talks with gwen a describes their last meet up as that magicial amazing wonderful date we had her response is we had coffee eddy everytime i see this scene i just imagine their date being him just bragging about his camera skills gear the entire time he s taking photos of her going now i mean you look fine now but with this high depth lense oooo you look way better we ccapture every single pore some little spots here there but don t worry i can touch that up for a crime peter rightfully has to clear spider man s name and rightfully turns brock in peter doesn t even steal gwen she just liked peter and barely dated brock at all then finding out what he s
