iconic is right it turned out one of the best ways to have a superhero movie based off of spider powers thrive in a non superhero movie consumed early s was to hire a horror director and danny elfman to do the music is it hammy yeah dated definitely but considering there was no avengers no expanded universe or guarantees it was masterful in holding its own and building to more the music though is underrated the horns when he first climbs the walls the percussion at the start of the opening credits even the quiet moments are amazing from elfman and then raimi gives you jump scares and horror scenes to sell the danger of the villains build suspense and tension tobey for me embodies peter parker in the perfect way in being goofy nerdy and humble even spider man which everyone seems to misunderstand that the dancing is meant to be cringey we see how vindictive he can be when pushed by overinflated self esteem and harris was perfect as a comic accurate aunt may too keeping us guessing on whether she knows or not then you have brilliant villains in dafoe molina and church each in their own way tragic in their descent downfall and obsession not to mention acted brilliantly and j jonah jameson one of the most perfect castings in superhero movies still to this day na na you don t wanna talk to bruce campbell s character that dude is mysterio that ad was surprisingly motivating too spider man still battles with into the spider verse for my favourite spidey movie they both manage to bring out the best of their characters for sm it was peter feeling the weight of his responsibility even though it isn t helping his personal life at all a crisis of character between peter and octavius as for well it s not as bad as people have made a mandela it s more not as good as the others it still holds up well but you can feel that this wasn t the same enthusiasm raimi had for the other two venom btw my favourite was kraven and i am still waiting as a side act with that lowkey sexual assault allegory and the amnesia arc felt like tv episode stories compared to planned ideas like lizard vulture and mysterio lamenting on the what could ve been aside the film had some really good scenes in it the reasons you love spider man is why this trilogy thrives because it understood that as the selling point and technically still does in later films

for me andrew garfield s peter parker spider man didn t have the selfless feel about him it never really felt like he was continually struggling to make the right choice for the citizens of ny or the people he loved the choice to use his power to help everyone else at the cost of stability in his own life so much as it felt like he saw a bad guy and was the only person he knew who could stop them his deciding to become spider man almost felt a bit to me like a convenient way to test out and practice his powers in a way that helps people instead of out of a desire to actually use his powers to help those people his repeatedly dunking on the car thief while apprehending him definitely felt that way as it showed no empathy whatsoever he even promised the police chief that he wouldn t date gwen in order to keep her safe and then reneged on that promise like two scenes later immediately before the end of the movie and there was the flash basketball scene in which he completely humiliated flash even though flash was a bully and didn t really reflect on himself becoming the bully in that situation unless i m forgetting that part of the movie revenge on a bully only creates another bully and that s one of the reasons why i really like the idea that j jonah jameson turns ny against spidey in the raimi trilogy he continually chooses to sacrifice for them despite them not understanding what he does for them tobey maguire s peter parker feels the impact of not following uncle ben s advice right at the beginning of the first movie because he was angry and chose not to use his powers in a moment that probably would have constituted responsible use ben died and knowing that making the same decision in the future could indirectly cause others to suffer he decides to embody ben s wisdom and that decision does not come without more suffering the entire second movie highlights the poverty failing academics struggling relationships and other difficult things that come from silently taking on that kind of responsibility to the point where peter just decides to hang up the mantle because he can t take it anymore but he eventually realizes that someone has to protect others from doc ock and he is the one capable of that and then the third movie tackles that same stuff from another angle he struggles with feelings of vengeance against ben s perceived killer and anger toward harry mj brock and jjj and as a result he embraces a dark side of those emotions that ends up becoming dangerous to him and others venom wasn t even needed for those emotions to be brought to the surface within peter but it was a convenient way to include the villain and highlight those struggles and it was a good way to show the impact of the choice peter made to not lean into those temptations further though the suit gave him power and supposedly improved his life in various ways he ultimately made the decision to do what was best for others and shed it i almost feel like garfield s peter would have continued wearing the suit because of the ways that it seemingly improved his life until he either hit rock bottom and had no other choice or until some scientist told him that it was a vicious alien that was trying to conquer the world or something not because shedding it would be the right thing for others however i could just be misremembering the tone of garfield s character that the movies put out i haven t seen them in quite a long while but that s the impression that i had when i used to watch them

from everyone on earth from the way he views things to what he is capable of it s why i loved venom s ability to grab the sandman despite the fact that he should ve crumbled at his fingertips it was so cool that he defied logic because he was an alien an unknown entity venom is literally built different and because of that he brings new options the option to properly kill sandman instead of trapping him not only that but the various new ways he could make pretty much anything easier i like to look at the newest interpretation of venom spiderman when i use this line in spider s shadow which is a what if about spiderman keeping the venom symbiote it portrays their relationship as two variations of the same morals like how they did with otto venom finds fulfillment in being a hero was about dealing with responsibility along with it s consequences then number should have been about teaching responsibility to show the everyone and more importantly to show the character venom that the best take i heard about the raimi films is that a lot of the dislike they got was simply an unfortunate symptom of the time the raimi movies were among the first big superhero movies when the supehero genre was still new and struggling to be seen as mature with many still having the mindset of superheroes are just for kids so having the raimi movies be a lot more light hearted and at times somewhat goofey in their presentation made many people believe that they simply weren t what was needed at the time the films were too goofy to childish they weren t the proof they wanted to show the world that superhero movies were the mature pieces of art they wanted them to be seen as so there was a bit of a backlash because of it however now looking back at it with the superhero genre being firmly ingrained into today s society a lot of people can look back and are much more open to appreciate the movies for what they were

i found rewatching spiderman this year caused me to have a massive epiphany that i needed this year i rewatched it shortly before my rd bday back a few months ago when i was extremely depressed and didn t care if i lived or died i felt like i was in such a low nothing spot of my life i don t have alot of money i had supportive friends who were there but i wasn t always able to with them cuz school and work and financial problems and was dealing with a terrible breakup following an extremely toxic and manipulative relationship and a part of me wanted to forget my responsibilities and take what i thought was an easier path it caused me to have a crisis of my future and a fear of my dreams and my responsibilities i feared what it meant to be a hero and what it meant to be good and watching spiderman and getting to aunt mays hero speech made me realize alot i knew my dreams were turning into a fuck it whatever mindset and it s not right and i was close to going down the same path that someone who hurt me was going down i realized alot of things i wanted weren t what i needed and it brought me to tears as i began remembering what i am and what i want

i think the mask being a limiting factor for conveying emotion is usually used to the writers advantage in the climax of spider man stories there s a reason why it s so common for them to remove or tear peter s mask in the most important battles of a lot of spider man media after all the most compelling aspect of the hero is the struggle of the man behind the mask we get used to see spider man show emotion the best way he can through the mask but when that is removed the impact is much greater and even more so if the person he s fighting is either someone peter is attached to or someone he hates the mask is a limiting factor but in a certain way it can also be used as an advantage

amazing review mark perfectly capsulated the heart themes of the raimi trilogy spider man is the weakest of the trilogy for sure but it s not a bad conclusion at all it s not a rise of skywalker that effectively ruined the overall trilogy story it s painfully clear that what raimi originally intended for the third film was a deeply personal villian in harry osborn as the new goblin after all in the first movie he was completely overshadowed in the eyes of his father by peter then in the second film after the death of his father he becomes a successful business man but his father isn t there to see it in his eyes bc of spider man after he wrongfully thinks spidey killed him in the second movie he hates spider man resents peter for not telling him how he can find him leading to him finding out that peter is spider man then given the means to enact his revenge when he finds the goblin tech this should ve clearly been built up to the finally of his arc in the third movie at first it seems like that s what s gonna happen after all in begins with harry injecting himself w the gas norman did then attacking peter w no warning perfect chief kiss you did it but then he gets amnesia for rlly no reason other than raimi was forced to do the venom symbiote stuff when he didn t rlly want to knew having villains was too much so he sacrificed harry s arc to make room for venom sandman originally he wanted the villains to be harry as the main one sandman as a secondary villian but the studio pushed heavily for venom so changes had to be made honestly it s fine as a conclusion to the trilogy as is despite being the weakest of the trilogy but i am saddened i didn t get to see harry be the true final villian of the film completing his negative arc like just imagine if the final fight had harry do something like kill aunt may threaten mj causing peter to get furious savagely beat harry into near death only stopping by mj s direct intervention then having peter harry having one last heart to heart leading to harry sacrificing himself after realizing what he s done what he s become that would ve been better than what we got overall

i really enjoyed the video as a big spiderman fan however i must point out that i disagree to some extent with the mask part i get where you re coming from but i would like to point out one obvious thing and one more in character thing the obvious one being that since it is a real costume it is hard to reflect properly what a drawing can do with ease now the other thing it s the importance of the mask in some comics peter has stated that the mask helps him to be more brave since he is able to hide his fear he really feels when encountering dangerous situations with this in mind i feel the mask fulfills it s role since we re unable to see how he truly feels on the situations he feels more invencible this makes the moments where he actually takes it away or gets it damaged one to reveal more of his face the more powerful we re shown in those moments the reality that being that inside the invencible heroe s mask there s a vulnerable teenager this is in fact one of the major points of the spiderman stopping the train scene people see spiderman as a unstoppable heroe they thought he was a capable adult due to his abilities and then an unmasked spiderman that saved them faints so it s their time to save him in the realization that he s pretty young and that he can be beaten embracing even more the message that there s a hero in all of us

honestly the degree of positivity for this video makes me worried he ll tear the amazing spider man apart the nd film i don t mind as much at all the only good parts are the action visuals effects and choreography the rest is something but the amazing spider man in my opinion is by far the most realistic of all of the movies i don t mind in terms of visuals or anything like that i m talking about the characters peter parker in the amazing spider man does every single decision a year old teen would do if you ask me in spider man it s kind of all of a sudden yes he starts by using his powers selfishly and not doing the right thing leads to ben s death so he realizes that he s supposed to use those powers for good i get it but in the amazing spider man he doesn t realize that he acts like an anti hero until captain stacy just lays it on him during dinner and what follows is the famous bridge scene where he must make a choice between the lizard or saving a child why did he go to the bridge in the first place because something big seems to happen over there he s a teen he s curious he loves using his powers feeling like he can do things no one can but that s not all there is he seens captain stacy the man who was criticizing him just a few moments earlier go in a hurry and investigate peter might have wanted to prove to this man he was doing the right thing or perhaps taunt him by doing his job right in front of his face but when he s at that bridge anyone with the same powers as him would have done the same prioritize rescuing the child instead of pursuing the lizard right after the bridge scene we see him staring at his mask realizing that there s a lot more he can with those powers he went there because there was trouble but there everything lead to him saving the child and now he realizes everything he could have done had he had that precise objective the whole time at first it s curiosity now it s responsibility and the movie makes that very clear because right after stacy announces a warrant for his arrest there s now some genuine drawbacks to being spier man and helping people but now that he understands his lesson he doesn t care he knows he has a moral obligation to use those powers to stop that beast and save people i gotta go after it that s not your job maybe it is i hope mark sees all that and i have faith he will

while i do think the mask design philosophy is a fair critique as it is an inherent issue when transferring the facial expressions of a dude wearing a mask from comics to live action the spidey mask in live action works because you can t tell who s supposed to be in the mask unlike other marvel heroes who either don t care about hiding their identities or would like the whole world to know who they are under the mask like your iron mans your doctor stranges your guardians of the galaxy and so on spidey has always been a character where no matter which incarnation or universe the spidey comes from the mask is always a blank slate for whatever that version of spidey is as a person underneath the title of being a spider man anybody can wear the mask as a certain animated film about a spider verse would like to say which was an aspect of spider man as a general character that i feel like wasn t really brought up when addressing the mask issue as much as it was an issue for peter being the only spider man to exist within the three live action universes

from what i ve noticed when speaking to fans about the spiderman movie adaptations and casting there is always a substantial dichotomy between casual movie fans and dedicated fans who ve read the comics and the wide variety of media in terms of a stand alone movie with no back catolougue or previous source material i can see why folks enjoy toby s portrait of peter parker but in many ways the raimi version of peter is far from accurate to the source material i d go as far as saying maguires rendition is unrecognizable to the character of peter parker peter isn t exactly a prom king but he s nowhere near as timid unconfident and humorless as the way raimi rewrote the character what made peter so attractive and polarizing to the readers was the fact that he was not just likable but charismatic exceedingly intelligent and funny peter was so humble and down to earth but still kept his head up and did his best to fulfill his responsibilities in my opinion i d say spiderverse and the mcu adoptions seem to be the best most accurate adaptations of the character as a viewer i don t see toby maguires rendition of peter out of costume could be the same spiderman we see moments later saving lives and swining webs

you didn t mention anything about the sections of mandatory sneak missions with m j and that morales kid not to mention the biggest failure in this game is putting that morales kid in the game as a forced way of introducing him as spiderman for the next sequel yes i sound like a racist don t care what you or anyone thinks miles morales does not belong in a spiderman game let alone spiderman spiderman has always been caucasian and should stay that way

finished spider man yesterday and boy was it an amazing spectacular and quite ultimate game it s so obvious that insomniac poured their soul into in it really makes you feel like spider man and it has a lot of flair the combat the traversal the quips the voice acting the costume design both for spidey and the baddies almost everything is superb the villain s motivations could have been a bit more fleshed out that s true but the story is good too at points i was left a bit scratching my head why the main villain went all batshit crazy but i pieced it together eventually what i don t completely get though is spoilers was he evil all along if you look around the lab and comment on the raft drawings and defense contracts otto has a reason for them but he isn t using the intracranial implant yet so was he planning the breakout before attaching the arms was he trying to warn peter even then that he knows he is spidey with the newspaper articles about electro fisk scorpion vulture and rhino one thing about this i loved how otto showed remorse when he threw pete from the raft his face was all torn up with pain for a split second then he went back to being doctor octopus the relationship between otto and pete was really cool and the harry twist was awesome as well i had already finished the research stations and knew something was up with harry but didn t expect him to be in that lab when you re playing with mj end of spoilers i really liked the peter parts as well this is something that rocksteady completely ignored with batman they never had parts where you are bruce true enough bruce sees himself as batman and bruce is a mask for him but still the peter parts were a good break from the action and i loved the puzzles too they emphasized that he is a scientist i liked the parts with mj and miles too it showed a different side of the world where you are two mostly defenseless people that are just trying to help nonetheless minor spoiler that ending bit between miles and pete was absolute gold not that weird d end of spoiler the side activities are an interesting part i actually really liked them sure you could say that they re repetitive but each had a story tidbit and different thing to do even the backpacks they had background info that s relatable to the world insomniac really have a visible passion for the webhead i always had tokens for suits and gadgets because i kept doing side activities since i found them fun the side quests though were a bit eh but suitable nonetheless yeah i really liked the game and i can t wait for a sequel or rather the dlcs for now also the world really feels lived in and the twist in the last act was welcome the fact that npcs talk to you in both positive and negative tones is awesome and realistic i also enjoyed perching on top of the groups of enemies and listening to their conversations
